nigerian_organizations.name: Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC)
nigerian_organizations.notes: Primary agency for financial crimes. Reporting can be done via written reports, email, their 'Eagle Eye' app, and social media.[span_0](end_span)

nigerian_organizations.name: Nigeria Police Force (NPF)
nigerian_organizations.notes: Report scams to local police stations or specialized units like the Special Fraud Unit (SFU). [span_1](start_span)The main website can help locate contacts.[span_1](end_span) Some state commands might have specific online portals for certain complaints.

nigerian_organizations.name: Nigerian Communications Commission (NCC) - Consumer Complaint Portal
services: Complaints regarding telecom services used in scams
nigerian_organizations.notes: For issues where telecom services were instrumental in the scam.[span_2](end_span)

nigerian_organizations.name: Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) - Consumer Protection Department
services: Complaints against financial institutions regulated by CBN
nigerian_organizations.notes: Escalate complaints here if your financial institution fails to resolve an issue related to a scam (e.g., unauthorized transactions). [span_3](start_span)You must complain to your bank first.[span_3](end_span)

nigerian_organizations.name: Legal Aid Council of Nigeria
services: Free legal aid and advice to indigent Nigerians
nigerian_organizations.notes: Provides legal assistance for criminal and some civil matters to those who qualify. [span_4](start_span)Contact specific offices.[span_4](end_span)

nigerian_organizations.name: Federal Competition and Consumer Protection Commission (FCCPC)
nigerian_organizations.notes: Handles complaints about fraudulent business practices and can mediate disputes or issue sanctions.

nigerian_organizations.name: National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) Nigeria
nigerian_organizations.notes: Relevant if a scam leads to or involves human rights abuses.

nigerian_organizations.name: Public Complaints Commission (PCC) Nigeria
services: Investigation of administrative injustice by public bodies
nigerian_organizations.notes: Nigeria's Ombudsman. May be relevant if there's a failure by a government agency in relation to scam victim support or prevention duty.

nigerian_organizations.name: Nigerian Bar Association (NBA)
nigerian_organizations.notes: The national body for lawyers. Some state branches or committees may offer pro-bono legal aid schemes or human rights support.

african_organizations.name: African Commission on Human and Peoples' Rights (ACHPR)
services: Adjudication on human rights violations by State Parties to the African Charter
african_organizations.notes: For cases where scams involve state-level negligence or complicity leading to human rights violations, after exhausting local remedies.

african_organizations.name: ECOWAS Community Court of Justice
services: Adjudication on human rights violations within ECOWAS member states
african_organizations.notes: Relevant for human rights violations related to scams within West Africa, after local remedies are exhausted.

worldwide_organizations.name: INTERPOL
worldwide_organizations.notes: Individuals report to their national police, who then liaise with INTERPOL for international cases.[span_5](end_span)

worldwide_organizations.name: Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) - Internet Crime Complaint Center (IC3) (USA)
services: Collects and analyzes reports of cyber-enabled crime with a U.S. nexus
worldwide_organizations.notes: File a complaint if the scam has a U.S. connection (victim, perpetrator, or infrastructure).[span_6](end_span)

worldwide_organizations.name: Action Fraud (UK)
services: UK's national reporting centre for fraud and cybercrime
worldwide_organizations.notes: Report if the scam has a UK connection. [span_7](start_span)For scam websites, also see NCSC UK.[span_7](end_span)

worldwide_organizations.name: Federal Trade Commission (FTC) (USA)
services: Collects reports on scams, fraud, and bad business practices with a U.S. nexus

worldwide_organizations.name: econsumer.gov (ICPEN - International Consumer Protection and Enforcement Network)
services: Portal for reporting international scams and disputes with foreign companies
worldwide_organizations.notes: Complaints are shared with consumer protection agencies in ICPEN member countries.[span_9](end_span)

worldwide_organizations.name: Global Anti-Scam Alliance (GASA)
services: Research, awareness, collaboration on scam prevention
worldwide_organizations.notes: A resource for understanding global scam trends and prevention. [span_10](start_span)Does not typically take individual scam reports for investigation.[span_10](end_span)

worldwide_organizations.name: Access Now
worldwide_organizations.notes: Provides digital security advice and assistance to individuals and organizations at risk, which can be relevant for victims of online scams.
